reviews.sentence: Convenient and comfortable. The downtown Sheraton is conveniently located near the freeway in walking distance of activities like the market movie theater food and bars. The rooftop pool was a great way to cool off from the hot days before returning to the clean and comfortable room. My fiance loved the bedding and pillows. Our only complaint is that parking was full 2 of the 3 nights and they gave us a voucher to park a couple blocks away. Fortunately I did not do express checkout or I would have been charged for their self parking. Other than that it was a great experience.

It was a pleasant stay. Front desk was very accommodating. High quality hotel for very reasonable price. Centrally located in downtown Phoenix and close to attractions such as museums and sports venues. None I could think of.

Overpriced. The room was small the ironing board was small. The hotel is nicely decorated and located very conveniently if you are attending a convention at the convention center. About a 3 minute walk. There are a few restaurants right across the street. Another great asset is the fitness room one of the best I have encountered at a hotel. But overall I felt the hotel was overpriced for what you get.

The name says it all Grand. Our family stayed here for the Miss Teen USA pageant that was held at the Symphony Hall across the street. The staff was kind and very helpful. The rooms were clean and offered everything needed for a great stay. The beds could stand to be a little more comfortable but overall the room was great. There is a great workout facility and outdoor pool on the 4th floor. The downtown views from the pool was fabulous. Self Parking is 20 night in the garage that is attached to the hotel. Valet is also availablethere is a Movie theatre across the street and several restaurants within walking distance.

Home away from home. I stayed at this hotel for a week and appreciated the quality of service the prime location and the hotel amenities. Staff was friendly and helpful and plentiful Even when there was a line at check in the line moved quickly and the staff was efficient and thorough with questions I had and any help I needed. The rooms were spacious and clean. I felt like I was a valued customer and was treated with courtesy and a smile by the housekeeping staff and the front desk. The location of this hotel is ideal for activities in the area and it is close to shopping and restaurants.

Conference hotel. We stayed in a standard room with two beds. It also included a decent sized bathroom and a mini refrigerator but no microwave. The closet was pretty small. The workout facilities were very good with plenty of cardio equipment as well as weight machines and a variety of dumbbells. The pool was excellent for lap swimming. The hotel food was pretty good.
Beautiful rooms and awesome gym.

Very happy with our stay in all respects. Upgraded to a top floor suite for a very reasonable sum. Incredible view big comfortable quiet room front desk could not have been any more helpful or friendly. District cafe is excellent. Half mile to the sports stadiums even less to convention center. Only problem was the heat 90 low and 14 high. Yikes. But that is August in Phoenix. Very impressed with the Sheraton and would certainly visit again.
Good room good gym. Room temp is kinda finiky.
Love this spot. Close to everything the rooms are huge and the gym is big and nicely situated close to the pool action. The staff here is almost always super cool and friendly during check ins.

Conference Lodging. In town for several days for a conference. Hotel was clean well staffed convenient to Phoenix Conference Center and other locations and offered a few dining options. Fourth floor pool was a nice getaway. Only down side was water being shut off for several hours during mid morning to mid afternoon especially on a Sunday when outdoor activities were going on. Short walk from Chase Field and less than 15 minutes from Airport.
Really good. Room service super accurate and punctual. Clean sheets and towels every day. Personal super nice and courteous. The facilities as gym pool etc are a bit expensive but good.

Call ahead to see what events are being hosted. Tip. call ahead to see what events are being hosted. This well appointed hotel has great potential to be a relaxing retreat. It was poor timing on our part to be there when the girls volleyball playoffs were at the Event Center next door. The hotel was overrun with all the teenage girls staying there. We went to use the pool for our afternoon float before dinner and it was full of volleyball players. We gave up and strolled around the roof top little garden they have and then sought out some peace in the area they call the Valley View. Same level as the pool. We were the only ones in the pool the next morning. Was long enough to do laps and had a jacuzi beside it. The pool attendant was very friendly and considerate. He did not add any chemicals while we were swimming in it. The fitness center was large with both cardio and weight training well covered with options. The gift shop was large with lots of nice items including clothing to purchase. The saleclerk was very friendly and offered me water and a cookie while I was shopping. The bartenders were very helpful as we asked about dinner options. The restaurant called District was nice and there were good food options. The service was not on par with the caliber of the hotel. I did have to ask 3 different people for lemons for our water and our bread was removed before we were finished eating. Dinner salads were good but alot of money for just salad. All desserts had dairy in them they removed the apple crumble last month a mistake on their part. The executive lounge had a good variety of food choices and snacks and great rice crispy squares. Seemed like a good hotel for executive meetings with a business center and a Fedx store in the hotel. Can watch the airplanes come and go with out hearing them.

Not a very good expereince. Location. The hotel was preparing for total shutdown for complete renovation informed only at check in. There were noisy maintenance activities going on the upper floors water supply was stopped every day for several hours. Such issues should be informed well before checking in booking in this hotel.
Thus held an activity for the students which was nice but the adults did not have enough seating. Of course this is a rare event with hundreds of people waiting in a lobby.

Family Phoenix Vacation not impressed. According to the pictures and star rating we were expecting much more from the Sheraton Phoenix Downtown. The pool which is on the 4th floor of the hotel leaves much to be desired it ’s totally average do n’t be mislead by the pictures the pro are the pool towels. The 4th floor outdoor grill by the pool was closed the entire week we were there with no explanation as to why it was closed. There are no showers by the pool or fitness area. There are no guest laundry facilities. The coffee snack bar in the lobby has the strangest hours seemed like it was never open. Now to the rooms small small small rooms old and outdated is not even the word to describe them. They are filthy dirty. The washrooms need some sort of shelving unit so you have an place to put your stuff especially when traveling as a family of four. The carpet barely if ever gets vacuumed when housekeeping comes it really appears as though they just make the beds and only the towels are replaced in the washroom. The washroom was left with hairs all over the floor and around the toilet area. And we do leave housekeeping a tip. Had to actually speak to front desk about the cleaning and the girl at the front desk gave me attitude. You work in the hospitality business show it. The furniture is old and scratched up. Small TV in the room had issues with the remote. My son met a nice young traveler that week and they became friends so of course you speak of your rooms and apparently the single guy got an upgrade for free to a suite with a walkout on the 4th floor. We had asked for an upgrade because the room is super small for 4 people and were told we would have to pay for a suite. Interesting. Hotel lobby washrooms are nice but you need that quality in the rooms not in the lobby. Checked out other hotels in the area the Renaissance looked amazing and beautiful the Hyat and the Kimpton. Should have stayed there.

Good Stay Despite Construction. The Sheraton Phoenix Downtown is in a generaly good location. While much of the public spaces and services were limited by on going construction the staff was helpful. Also the new rooms were comfortable with nicer bath rooms than many other hotels in the same category. While it is not an issue relative to the hotel itself we found out that many of the better restaurants attractions outside of certain sports attractions are at least a car ride away.

Yes I recommend avoiding this hotel too. This was just a very disappointing experience. A non existent bell man was also our experience and we had to carry roll our bags quite a distance before we reached check in on the second floor and then all the way to our room. It took several minutes to even get an elevator from the ground to the second floor. A large hotel such as this should have more than 2 small working elevators. Then breakfast it is either an over priced buffet of lukewarm mediocre choices or a breakfast sandwich a bowel of oatmeal or a high fat pastry in the little coffee shop. The concierges lounge is also being renovated so no possible food light refreshment options there either. Then there was the hotel wide internet issue which created monumental challenges for myself and my traveling companion. The phone in the room was very staticky which made it difficult to talk with the front desk and housekeeping staff. AND some of the staff management could really use some remedial training in their communication skilsOn the positive side of things the flat screen TV in our room was great. The roof top pool spa lounge area is also nice however because there are not too many places to go and hang out within the hotel due to this renovation process this area was very crowded the noise level very high and seating very limited. We will be staying elsewhere next time we are in the Phoenix Downtown area at least for the next several months.

Luxurious Stay in the City. A luxurious stay in downtown Phoenix. The Sheraton is a beautiful property with an amazing staff. With great amenities go check out the roof top pool and excellent fitness center. It is centrally located minutes away from the airport and 15 minutes away from Tempe and Scotsdale. If you are a sports fan it is walking distance from the Suns and Diamond Backs stadium. I highly recommend this hotel.
